plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub popular for its large, showy, rose-like flowers with glossy foliage, often blooming in late winter to early spring.
plants.location: East Asia, cultivated widely in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellia flowers were prized by the Victorians and symbolize admiration and perfection.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant known for its white to pinkish flowers that often bloom in the coldest winter months, sometimes peeking through snow.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Christmas Rose blooms mainly in mid-winter and its early flowers were used historically in traditional medicine.

plants.name: Mimosa pudica
plants.description: A tropical flowering plant famous for its rapid leaf movements when touched, producing small, pink, fluffy flower heads in late winter and early spring in warmer climates.
plants.location: Tropical America, widely naturalized in tropical and subtropical regions
plants.funFact: The leaves close up when disturbed to protect from harm, a defense mechanism called thigmonasty.

plants.name: Acacia dealbata
plants.description: A fast-growing tree with feathery silver foliage and bright yellow, fragrant spherical flower clusters blooming in late winter to early spring.
plants.funFact: Acacia dealbata flowers are often used in perfumery and celebrated for their vibrant color and scent.
